projects.title: Story Teller
projects.cardDescription: An AI powered story generator that creates unique stories with the click of a button.

paragraphData.paragraphContent: StoryTeller is a web application that allows users to create stories. Leveraging the power of ai, users can generate unique stories with the click of a button. It was created during Hacked one of the biggest Hackathons in Alberta, Canada at the University of Alberta. Our five person team had a goal to implement as many AI tools as possible to create a unique and fun experience for users.

StoryTeller uses openAI's generative text model to generate stories. Users can input a prompt and the model will generate a story based on the prompt. It is also capable of generating images that go along with your story using Stable Diffusion! Not to mention the read along feature that allows you to listen to your story using Eleven Labs Text to Speech!

projects.title: FireSafe
projects.cardDescription: Forest fire software that uses machine learning to locate secluded locations and homes

paragraphData.paragraphContent: FireSafe is an application designed to keep individuals in high risk areas updated on fires. It also ensures that no individual gets left behind in the event of a forest fire eruption. FireSafe uses complex machine learning to locate secluded locations and homes, allowing responders to go down a checklist of locations and ensure individuals are all aware of fire threat and prepared to evacuate.

FireSafe uses machine learning to locate secluded locations and homes. It also ensures that no individual gets left behind in the event of a forest fire eruption. FireSafe uses machine learning to locate secluded locations and homes. It also shows the potential risk of a fire and the radius in which it will potentially reach.
Check out our video presentation here

projects.title: Froggy Jumper
projects.cardDescription: 2D side scroller game where you play as a frog and jump over snakes to collect flies

paragraphData.paragraphContent: Froggy Jumper is a fast paced side scroller where your objective to survive as long as you can. The game is simple, jump over the snakes and collect the flies. The longer you survive the faster the game gets.

To put it simple I love frogs! I think they are the coolest animals on the planet. I wanted to make a game that was fun and simple to play. I also wanted to make a game that was challenging and fun to play. I hope you enjoy playing Froggy Jumper as much as I enjoyed making it.

projects.title: Event Horizon
projects.cardDescription: Android mobile app event manager that allows users to create and manage events

paragraphData.paragraphContent: Event Manager is an android mobile application that allows users to create and manage events. Users can create events, invite friends, and keep track of upcoming events. The app was created as a final project for CMPUT 301 - Software Engineering at the University of Alberta.

projects.title: Twitter Backend
projects.cardDescription: Twitter backend clone that allows users to create tweets, follow users, and like tweets using SQL

paragraphData.paragraphContent: Twitter Backend is a backend clone of Twitter that allows users to create tweets, follow users, and like tweets. This was a project for CMPUT 291 - File and Database Management at the University of Alberta with a team of four people working together Our group had to design the database schema given the requirements and then implement it to make a functioning backend.

I learned about developing a database schema for a project and how to implement it to make a functioning backend. I also learned how relational databases work and how to use SQL to interact with the database. This project was a great learning experience and I am excited to continue learning more about databases and backend development throughout my future career in software developement.

paragraphs.title: Background
paragraphs.paragraphContent: Tyler Beach is a dedicated and passionate 23-year-old computing science student residing in Edmonton, Canada. Currently in his fourth year at the University of Alberta, Tyler has cultivated a deep interest in software development, with a particular focus on front-end technologies like React. His technical versatility extends to multiple programming languages, including Python, Java, and C, as well as a growing expertise in backend technologies such as Express. Tyler's commitment to continuous learning and personal growth is evident through his proactive involvement in various personal and academic projects. Outside of his academic pursuits, Tyler is known for his love of frogs, which reflects his appreciation for nature and the environment. As he looks forward to starting his professional career, Tyler is eager to leverage his skills and knowledge in a dynamic and challenging work environment.

paragraphs.title: Education
paragraphs.paragraphContent: Tyler is a fourth year student at the University of Alberta studying Computing Science. He has a passion for software development and is always looking for new ways to improve his skills. Tyler is currently looking for a summer internship in software development to further his skills and gain experience in the field.

paragraphs.title: Technologies
paragraphs.paragraphContent: Tyler has developed a strong proficiency in front-end development, particularly with React. In addition to his expertise in JavaScript, he is skilled in Python, Java, and C, which enables him to approach problems from multiple technical perspectives. He is continuously expanding his knowledge and is currently delving into backend technologies such as Express to evolve into a comprehensive full-stack developer. Tyler's project portfolio includes Event Horizon, an Android application developed with Java and Firebase; Story Teller, a React and Flask-based web application for generating and narrating children's stories; and FireSafe, a real-time forest fire alert system built with Python, TypeScript, and TensorFlow. For a detailed overview of his skills and experience, please refer to his resume.

paragraphs.title: Experience
paragraphs.paragraphContent: While Tyler is in the early stages of his career and has yet to gain professional experience in software development, he has been proactive in building a strong foundation through a variety of personal and academic projects. These projects have allowed him to develop practical skills and demonstrate his ability to work with different technologies. For example, he created Event Horizon, an Android application for event check-ins, leveraging Java and Firebase. He also developed Story Teller, a web app using React and Flask to generate and narrate children's stories. Tyler is enthusiastic about applying his skills in a professional environment and is actively seeking opportunities to gain industry experience.
